Class Deck

java.lang.Object
  Deck

public class Deck
extends java.lang.Object

This class encapsulates the basic behaviors and characteristics of a standard deck of playing cards.

Constructor Summary
Deck()
          Creates a standard deck of 56 playing cards.

          Creates a custom deck from a specified set of pre-existing playing cards.

Constructor Detail

Deck

public Deck()
Creates a standard deck of 56 playing cards. precondition: none postcondition: myCards is initialized to hold each of the 56 unique cards in a standard deck of playing cards (i.e. 4 suits per deck, 14 alues per suit, including Jokers). Note: CardSuit.SUITS <-- Array of all card suits CardValue.VALUES <-- Array of all card values

Deck

public Deck(Card[] c)
Creates a custom deck from a specified set of pre-existing playing cards.

Parameters:
c - The array of cards to be included in this Deck precondition: c is an initialized array of 0 or more non-null Card objects. postcondition: This Deck contains the same elements in the same order as are stored in c.
Method Detail

size

public int size()
Returns the number of cards currently in the deck.

Returns:
The size of the deck. precondition: This Deck contains 0 or more non-null Card objects. postcondition: Returns the number of cards currently in this Deck algorithm: Return the length of the myCards array.

isEmpty

public boolean isEmpty()
Reports whether or not the deck is currently empty.

Returns:
true if there are no cards in the deck and false if there is at least one card in the deck. precondition: This Deck contains 0 or more non-null Card objects. postcondition: Returns a boolean value indicating whether this Deck is empty or not. algorithm: Return the result of testing if this.size() == 0.

public Card getCard(int n)
Returns the specified Card object.

Parameters:
n - The index position of the Card to be accessed.
Returns:
The Card object at index position n. precondition: 0 <= n < this.size() postcondition: Returns the Nth Card in this Deck algorithm: Return the Card object at index position n in the myCards array.

getCards

public Card[] getCards(int first,
                       int last)
Returns an array of the specified range of Card objects remaining in the deck (this does not include those cards that have already been dealt/removed from the deck).

Parameters:
first - The index position of the first card to be returned.
last - The index position of the last card to be returned.
Returns:
The specified array of the cards in the deck. precondition: 0 <= first <= last < this.size() postcondition: Returns an array containing the cards in this Deck from index positions first through last in the same order. algorithm: Declare an array of Card objects called subsetOfCards and initialize it to hold (last - first + 1) Card objects. For each index position, i, from first through (and including) last... ...get the Card at index position i of this Deck and copy it into index position (i - first) of subsetOfCards. Return the subsetOfCards array.

getCards

public Card[] getCards()
Returns an array of all Card objects remaining in the deck (this does not include those cards that have already been dealt from the deck).

Returns:
An array of the remaining cards in the deck. precondition: This Deck contains 0 or more Card objects. postcondition: Returns an array containing all of the cards in this Deck in the same order. algorithm: Return the result of invoking the previous getCards() method starting with index position 0 and ending with index position this.size() - 1.

public boolean equals(java.lang.Object x)
Indicates whether some other object is "equal to" this one (i.e., both Deck objects contain the exact same sequence of cards in the same order.

If d.size() != this.size()... ...return false. For each index position i in this Deck... ...if the card at index position i in this Deck does not equal (using the equals() method) the card at index position i in d... ...return false. Return true.

deal

public Card deal()
Removes the "top" card from the deck and returns this Card object. If the deck is currently empty, the method should return null.

Returns:
The top card in the deck. precondition: This Deck contains 0 or more non-null Card objects. postcondition: If this.size() > 0, removes and returns the first Card object this Deck. Otherwise, returns null. algorithm: Return the result of invoking the removeCard() method when n is 0.

deal

public Card[] deal(int n)
Removes the "top" n cards from the deck and returns an array of these Card objects.

Parameters:
n - The number of cards to be dealt from the deck.
Returns:
The top n cards in the deck. precondition: This Deck contains 0 or more non-null Card objects. postcondition: If this.size() > 0, removes and returns an array of the first n Card object in this Deck. Otherwise, returns null. algorithm: Declare an array of Card objects of length n and call it dealtCards. For each index position i in dealtCards... ...Deal a single card from this Deck and assign the card to index position i of dealtCards. Return the value of dealtCards.

pickACardAnyCard

public Card pickACardAnyCard()
Randomly selects and removes a card from the deck and returns this Card object.

Returns:
The randomly selected card in the deck. precondition: This Deck contains 0 or more non-null Card objects. postcondition: If this.size() > 0, removes and returns a randomly selected Card object this Deck. Otherwise, returns null. algorithm: Declare and integer called rand and initialize it with a random (but valid) index position from this Deck (i.e., 0 through this.size()-1, inclusive). Return the result of invoking the removeCard() method when n is rand.

insertCard

public void insertCard(int n,
                       Card c)
Inserts a card into the deck at the specified index position. The index positions for all subsequent cards already in the deck should shift down in the array to make room for the new card. If the index position is not valid for the current deck (i.e. index < 0 or index > size()), the card should be added to the "bottom" of the deck.

Parameters:
n - The index position where the Card object should be inserted.
c - The Card object being added to the deck. precondition: c is a non-null Card object. 0 <= n <= this.size() postcondition: Inserts c into this Deck at index position n. The length of myCards will be increased to allow for the added card. algorithm: If n is less than 0 or n is greater than the size of this Deck... ...Assign to n the size of this Deck. Declare an array of Card objects called temp and initialize it with new array that can hold this.size()+1 Card objects. For each index position i from 0 through n (exclusive)... ...copy the card from index position i of this Deck into index position i of temp. For each index position i from n through this.size() (exclusive)... ...copy the card from index position i of this Deck into index position i+1 of temp. Assign c into index position n of temp. Reassign myCards to be a reference to array temp.

insertCards

public void insertCards(int n,
                        Card[] c)
Inserts an array of Card objects into the deck starting at the specified index position. The index positions for all subsequent cards already in the deck should shift down in the array to make room for the new cards.

Parameters:
n - The index position where the Card objects should be inserted.
c - The array of Card objects being added to the deck. precondition: c contains 0 or more non-null Card objects. 0 <= n <= this.size() postcondition: Appends all of the Card objects in c to the end of this Deck. algorithm: For each Card object x in array c... ...insert the card at position n ...increment the value of n

swap

public void swap(int i,
                 int j)
Swaps the position of the 2 specified cards in the deck.

Parameters:
i - The index position of the first card to be swapped.
j - The index position of the second card to be swapped. precondition: 0 <= i, j < this.size() postcondition: Exchanges the positions of the Card objects at index positions i and j in this Deck. algorithm: Declare a temporary Card variable and assign it the Card object at index position i of this Deck. Copy the Card object in index position j of this Deck into index position i of this Deck. Copy the value of the temporary variable into index position j of this Deck.

contains

public boolean contains(Card c)
Reports whether or not the deck contains the specified card.

Returns:
true if the deck currently contains the specified Card object, false if it does not. precondition: c != null. A Card object is considered to be a match with another Card object if their equals() method returns true. postcondition: Returns true if c currently exists in this Deck and returns false if it does not exist in this Deck. algorithm: For each Card object x in the myCards array... ...if x matches c (using the equals() method)... ...return true. Return false.

hasDuplicates

public boolean hasDuplicates()
Reports whether or not the deck contains at least one pair of matching cards (i.e. same card value and suit).

Returns:
true if the deck currently contains the a pair of matching card objects, false if it does not. precondition: This Deck contains 0 or more non-null Card objects. A Card object is considered to be a match with another Card object if their equals() method returns true. postcondition: Returns true if this Deck contains at least 1 matching pair of Card objects. algorithm: For each index position i in this Deck... ...For each index position j from 0 through i-1... ...If the Card objects at index positions i and j match... ...return true. Return false.

shuffle

public void shuffle()
Randomly shuffles the contents of the deck. precondition: This Deck contains 0 or more non-null Card objects. postcondition: algorithm: For each index position i in this Deck... ...Declare and initialize a random (but valid) index position n from this Deck (i.e., 0 through this.size() - 1, inclusive). ...Swap the Card objects at index positions i and n.
